hopobject.body:
BeagleBone Cape Plug-In Board Weekly Trivia Contest

This is the last weekly trivia contest of 2012. We will start it off again January 7, 2013.

Week of December 17th, 2012
Enter by December 23rd, 2012

Prize: Four winners will each get one TI Meta Watch - the Bluetooth® enabled wearable development system enabling rapid development of ‘connected- watch’ applications.

Sponsor:


Question: According to the BeagleBone Capes product microsite on Mouser.com, what cape makes use of the DCAN1 interface of the AM335x processor?

Hint: The answer is on the BeagleBone Capes microsite on Mouser.com.

Name:

E-mail:

Twitter: (optional, but highly encouraged so we can tweet about your good fortune!)

Your country of residence: (optional)

Answer:


Previous questions & winners:

Week of December 10th

Sponsor: Adafruit Industries
Q: On the bottom of the BeagleBone there is an optional 20-pin connector that is not populated. What is the connector for and what part number is suggested you use if you want to solder it in?
A: CTI JTAG Programming connector, meant for the Samtec FTR-110-03-G-D-06 component
Winners: David Copeto from Germany, Hrishikesh Mehta from India & Kevin Taberski from the USA
Prize: They each get one Proto Cape Kit

Week of December 3rd

Sponsor: Total Phase
Q: The Beagle I2C/SPI Protocol Analyzer can return bit-level timing down to what resolution?
A: 20 ns
Winner: Peter Steinberg from Wisconsin
Prize: The Beagle I2C/SPI Protocol Analyzer

Week of November 26th

Sponsor: Mouser
Q: What TI product is featured on Mouser’s "Industrial Applications" web page?
A: TI's OMAP-L132 DSP+ARM Processors
Winners: Parag Barangale from India, Paolo Ferrer from California, Craig Powers from Colorado & Raul Alvarez Torrico from Bolivia
Prize: They each get one TI Meta Watch - the Bluetooth® enabled wearable development system enabling rapid development of ‘connected- watch’ applications

Week of November 19th

Sponsor: Total Phase
Q: What Total Phase tool can act as a master or slave device?
A: Aardvark I2C/SPI Host Adapter
Winner: Umakanta Patro from India
Prize: The Aardvark I2C/SPI Host Adapter
